txt.en: The central pool must have been lovely when it was clean and clear
These rooms would make handsome quarters for a Hobbit, if restored
'You scrounge up some light, a bit of straw for a seat, and a few plates will help, [placeholder]. Merry and I will find what else we need and meet back around this table.'
'There we are. A meal, all laid out. Fine work, friends! \n\n'Well, don't just stand about. Let us eat!'
'All this running about and scrounging has got my stomach rumbling right and proper.'

'What a remarkable place Gandalf found for us. Amazing to think that it is ours! Can you imagine what it will look like after the Gondorians have tidied it up? I should like to chat with them and make sure some of our things are placed in some of the rooms and that the kitchens in particular are restored, if anything.\n\n'My, but listen to me! A meal, some good company, and something to do and think about is welcome in this odd, free time after we won. But I hope old Gandalf doesn't think he's fooled us into forgetting about Mordor. We should still very much like to go. '
DNT oh do say you'll help us out with Mordor and join us on adventures. it will be such fun. we hobbits have got to stick together, don't we?
Talk to Merry
Talk to Pippin
Explore the central courtyard
Explore the side quarters
Explore the north passage
DNT hear the rest of the conversation
DNT hear what Gandalf has to say
Gandalf has led you to Bâr Thorenion in North Ithilien, cut into a high place above Cormallen. \n\nYou should talk to Gandalf to hear more about Bâr Thorenion.
DNT keep listening
Gandalf has invited everyone to step in and see Bâr Thorenion. You should talk to Merry and Pippin and hear what they think of it all.
'Well I suppose we really ought to have a look around, and see what we can see, hadn't we?'
Talk to Gandalf
'Is this considered a common home by the Big Folk around here? It is bigger than any house we ever saw in Breeland, and I dare say the whole of the Smials would fit in this one main hall!'
DNT - Blah!
Lay the things about the table
Explore Bâr Thorenion with Merry and Pippin.
After the question of whether they should go into Mordor, Gandalf announced he had something - or rather some-place - to show Pippin and Merry.
DNT And I tell you again, Mordor is no place for Hobbits.
DNT How can we just stop here, and never have seen it?
Collect Ithilien Wine ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
DNT Aye, how can we?
DNT yeah, what about htat, Gandalf?
Collect provisions crates ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
DNT We want to go into Mordor, and Gandalf says we hsouldn't.
DNT for all that you have seen, there are things in Mordor that are far more terrible
DNT We want to go into Mordor, and Gandalf says we hsouldn't. You're a hobbit. Stand by us.
DNT Ah, but think of the treasure we'll find.
Collect some kind of light ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Gandalf, what is this place?'
'I must go, I am afraid. Business to attend to!'
'You three make yourselves at home here... as much as you are able!'
DNT bring everything to the spot
DNT But gandalf, haven't we already been through darkness, danger, and war? What's so different about Mordor, really?

DNT At any rate, you shan't be going there today, so I have at least forestalled this folly, if not prevented it.

But never mind that, I have a surprise for you. No, don't start asking questions. You'll have to come with me if you want to find out what it is.

TELEPORT TO BAR THORONIAN
Talk to Pippin in the central courtyard, now that you have all explored Bâr Thorenion.
'Me, I'd like to poke around here some more.'
'Well, then adventure tomorrow, perhaps!'

'This place, Bâr Thorenion, is yours by royal decree of the kingdom of Gondor. You might think this is some jest of our old friend Aragorn, but in truth it was the soldiery and the rangers of Ithilien who petitioned him that it be so.

'I have brought you here prematurely, I confess. I know not how many men will be here tomorrow to make the place somewhat more habitable. I thought, however, you should like to see it sooner, so you could make your own plans.

'It will serve as a fine residence, indeed, for the time that you dwell here in Gondor before heading back Shireward. And, with any luck, it will keep you out of trouble and away from some of your more foolish notions -- for a few days, at least, if we are lucky.

'Well, come on then. Let us step inside!'
Help Pippin and Merry gather the things needed for a makeshift meal.
<rgb=#FF00FF>Sit</rgb> down and enjoy the meal
Explore the southern passage
Talk to Pippin
Collect some straw ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Collect some plates ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
You should bring the things you collected to the table.
Pippin and Merry have come running back with their own findings.

'I don't know if either of you observed the fact, but it so happens that we have everything we need for a simple makeshift meal - beginning with this old table someone happened to leave right here.

'I know that I could use a bite to eat. What about you two?

'There are crates of food and some bottles of old wine with the seals intact. Some light, a bit of straw for a seat, and a few plates will help. If you gather those, [placeholder], Merry and I will work on cups, knives, and anything else we can muster up.'
Instance: A Place for Hobbits
DNT Learn what Gandalf, Merry, and Pippin are dsicussing.
Little remains of ovens or cookery, but the kitchens must have been fine and well-provisioned, once
'No standing on ceremony. Not under these circumstances.'
'I'm far too starved for it, anyway.'
Join Merry and Pippin in enjoying the makeshift meal.
'It's just us friends here anyway, [placeholder].'
'Say, this isn't half bad, really.'
DNT talk to merry
'These Gondorians know their wine and dry provisions.'
'And hunger is the best seasoning, I always say.'
'Hunger, good company, pepper, salt, and cheer.'
'There now, that's a bit better.'
'Indeed, I could nearly go on adventure again.'
'Let's eat!'
'Why look at that, there!'
'Is that - no, it couldn't be!'
'Amazing. Simply amazing!'
'Just think what you could do with this!'
'I say, look at that.'
'I say!'
'Why, what's this here? a table?'
'A table? This makes me think of something. Does it for you, Merry?'
Collected a plate ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Collected Ithilien Wine ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'This, I must see for myself!'
Collected a provisions crate ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Indeed, Pippin, I think it does.'
Collected a useable candlestick ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Little but the kitchens lead off of this way
Join Merry and Pippin: <rgb=#FF00FF>sit</rgb> down by them and enjoy the makeshift meal.
There are spaces that might have been dining areas and studies off here... is that an overgrown garden beyond?
Talk to Pippin
Enjoy the meal

DNT talk to gandalf
Explore the kitchens
'Go on, see what you can see. As I said, some Men of Gondor will be by tomorrow to make the place a bit more livable.'
